title: The Essence Emporium options are pretty bad
body:
I have 40k blue essence and nothing to spend it on. I thought the special shop was supposed to be a way of dumping a lot of our blue essence for those of us who were going to have a lot, what happened? I don't think 40k is even that much to accumulate to begin with and i still have nothing to spend it on.

I don't play warwick
Chromas are w/e i might snag a few but it will hardly put a dent in my BE 
Mystery icons/ward skins who cares underwhelming 
 I'm not a 13 year old girl so I don't care about emotes
I already own all the champions i want 

soooooooooo what am i supposed to do? Could have easily added some legacy skins to the shop or had an early release of old christmas skins. This is pretty lame.

Fair - this is our first go round doing something like the essence emporium. We're planning on bringing it back in the future, so knowing what other kinds of things people would like to see is helpful!

If this is more of a seasonal thing that you guys could get more prep for, I have a few options in mind.

1. Unique BE Chromas for each champion's Classic.
 - One of the issues I currently have with buying Chromas with BE right now is that the current set of Chromas are either for Champions I don't play, or Champions' skins I don't own. While getting a new Chroma for every champion would take time, having at least 1 unique Chroma for each Champion that could be bought without RP from any player who owns them would be nice incentive.
2. Expressive Unique Emotes
 - Personally I'm in the camp who thinks that Emotes should just have a BE cost in general (Or a price re-evaluation) , but the current two emotes seem like they're just BE dumps, rather than being desirable icons for me to express myself in a match. Having solid and expressive BE exclusive emotes, and importantly having emotes that aren't just BE dumps, would be nice.
3. Seasonal BE Skin.
 - Simply put, something similar to how HexCrafting has their own unique skins, only this seasonal skin could be used as the big BE dump item. Have 1 per year with a high BE cost to reward habitual players, and we've got something to look forward to at seasons' end.
4. Rotating BE skin Sales
 - If we have a BE store only open at very specific times of year, you could have a rotating sale going on, spread out depending on the time the store stays up, and how frequently the store comes back. Change the sale every few days or each week while the BE emporium is in town and you can keep people checking up on what the store has to offer.

Um, content that's likely to appeal to a wide group of people perhaps?  Skins immediately come to mind, though not necessarily all of them.

The problem ultimately ends up being those of us who have 5+ digit BE (previously IP), and literally nothing we care about to do with it.  Most of the type of content that gets tossed out for things like this typically doesn't appeal to such individuals (I for one don't care about an emote reminding me that I have more BE than I know what to do with), and putting high-price items in alienates the people who don't have huge amounts of BE.

How about an option to revert failed reworks?  I would gladly spend all 126k of my BE to revert patch 4.13, 5.2 or one of the 5.22 "reworks" (guttings.)

If I could change one thing about league, I would go back to patch 5.22 and do almost literally the opposite of everything in that patch. 

5.22 made season 6 and 7 the shit shows that they were, and was the point where league began running down hill straight into the shitter.

Yes, I agree with the sentiment, but imo League started heading downhill long before that.  5.22 was certainly a major culprit, hence why I included it, but the first MAJOR mistake I personally know of along the downward spiral that is League would have to be patch 3.14.

The entire thing was handled poorly, a few DOZEN champions all saw HEAVY unjustifiable nerfs.  Rito created a MAJOR game imbalance that overflowed into every role, with repercussions being felt for years after, even slightly so today.  It born the ABUSE of mages in the support role, Morg, Brand, Annie, Malz; while simultaneously creating the problem of solo-lane support abuse, Soraka, Lulu.

I understand the sentiment of what Rito was TRYING to do in 3.14, but the execution of it was fucking TERRIBLE.  Essentially, it was their first attempt at what nowadays we know as 'Shield/Heal-buffing' passives, but rather than copying other mobas and creating a third 'utility' stat, Rito tried combining it into the AP stat.  A huge mistake that resulted in countless cancerous strategies that even now we must suffer through.

---

I digress though.  If I could spend 126k to buy an un-"reworked" (gutted) kit for a champion, I would.  I don't even fucking care if it permanently rewrote their current kit, I wouldn't be fucking reverting a "rework" (gutting) if that current kit were even USABLE.

I am fairly disappointed in this also. I have 50k + essence, like everyone else, there's nothing to spend it on. If they had chromas for every champ, I'd be all up for it. At the moment however, it's chromas for select skins I don't own or basic champions I don't play and don't want to. The emotes are crazy overpriced, but just rubbishy cartoony poros anyway and urf ww is out of the question. 

 For spending real money on rune pages, I'm stuck with a skin for a champ I don't like or play. There's 5 messy and bad rune pages distracting me at champ select or when I try to create a new page. The whole thing just feels really lackluster and a bit irritating tbh. They could do so much better than this. At least create a few more interesting emotes/icons/chromas to spend the essence on... And give people a skin for a champ they actually play semi-regularly. 

It's so demoralising to see roughly 7  years of playing league and investing real money into the game, just reward you with absolutely nothing except new and "exciting" gameplay where a bunch of people now one shot you.

I'm sitting at 87k AFTER I spent a bit on it. It is way less interesting than they made it out to be. The majority of stuff is just "silly mini cons", some ward skins, silly emotes I personally don't care about. I didn't have the 150k for Urfwick, but honestly I wouldn't have bought it anyways as I don't care about WW and the skins I have for him I like better anyways.

"We are going to be rewarding Vet players with more IP" they said a while back in one of those email things. Except that isn't true, cause the more you play the less BE you will end up getting, so eventually you will HAVE to start buying champs with RP. You will start getting to the point (like even by this time next year) where you will need 7-10 games to level up, and leveling up is the only way you get BE outside of loot boxes for getting an S, or flat out buying rp.

It's like they were trying to not talk about how shifty this was by talking up only the runes so much. The runes change was good, but this one is garbage unless you are a brand new player.

One random skin shard for all that BE, two if i hard grind it out for a few weeks.

I still remember Riot saying "There will be a lot of limited items available for blue essence, like Urfwick, emotes, icons and **MANY** more!"
Where is the "many more?"

Pretty pissed by this whole runes reforged stuff and essence emporium. First they increased the prices of skins and what not in the shop a few years ago, despite almost no inflation happening and people not really earning more in EU, but whatever.

Then they pretty much got me stuck with seven rune pages, instead of the 20 or so mastery pages and some standard runes that covered ALL champions. Now I basically have to create 1 or more rune pages for every champion, which means I've made an external spreadsheet to keep track of builds. After time it will probably get easier to relatively quickly change loadouts in champ select, but it's an unnecessary change that makes the game just more frustrating.

And now I'm sitting on 60k BE and there's literally NOTHING in the shop I want to spend it on: Chromas? Not really seeing the appeal of getting different colours for skins I've already bought with real money. They're basically 5 minutes of efforts reworks, yet are sold for 1/4th or so of the price of an actual skin. To be honest, Chromas should have perhaps been unlockable through playing. Similar to how HOTS does it (although they really went overboard with ffree stuff, not that I complain). Ward skins, emotes, icons? Really? Already got the Urfwick, since I had the old skin already. That leaves me with A gemstone, which would bring me up to 5. Yes, I have earned 4 gemstones from quite a few chests. And you need 10 for just one of the hextech skins...so it's a pointless investment as well for that price. Soooo, I guess I'm just gonna sit on my 60k and slowly lose enough currency to not be able to buy new champs with BE through mystery shards at some point in the future...which, I guess, is what they want to happen.

Honestly I feel like I got fucked, I spent RP on rune pages, I got blue essence in return and I'm just like "cool so now I just do what I did before and wait for a new champion"
